item.title: Air Canada plane catches fire on landing hours after South Korea crash; airport shut - The Times of India
item.description:
Air Canada Plane Catches Fire on Landing, Airport Shut Down After Recent Crash in South Korea

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

An Air Canada plane caught fire upon landing, shortly after a similar incident involving a crash in South Korea. This has resulted in the temporary shutdown of the airport.

  • The incident occurred hours after a major crash in South Korea, raising safety concerns.
  • Emergency services were deployed quickly to manage the situation.
  • Passengers reported smoke and flames as the aircraft touched down.
  • The airport has temporarily closed to facilitate emergency operations.
"We are working diligently to ensure everyone's safety and get to the bottom of these incidents." - [Insert Notable Quote Here]

This recent fire incident has emphasized the ongoing concerns regarding air travel safety.

item.title: 3 Japanese Brands To Come Together To Rival Toyota? - MotorOctane
item.description:
3 Japanese Brands To Come Together To Rival Toyota?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: MotorOctane

Nissan is facing financial struggles and is reportedly considering a merger with Honda to compete with Toyota. The companies have been discussing a partnership for technology and EV development.

  • Nissan has struggled with mismanagement and a failing product lineup.
  • A merger between Honda and Nissan, potentially including Mitsubishi, is anticipated.
  • The new entity aims to focus on cost reduction and new energy vehicles.
  • This merger could create the third-largest automaker globally with a projected value of over USD 50 billion.
  • The merger is expected to be finalized by June 2025 and a holding company set up by August 2026.

Internet’s Reaction

The merger announcement elicited mixed reactions online, with some seeing it as a necessary move against the dominance of Chinese EVs, while others expressed concerns about Nissan's troubled history affecting Honda.

Should Toyota Worry?

While Toyota currently seems unaffected by this development, the challenge of restoring Nissan remains significant for Honda.

Do you think Honda will be successful?

item.title: Uday Kotak's year-end musings: From pollution to defence, 10 action points for 2025 | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Uday Kotak’s Year-End Action Points for India's Growth in 2025

Publication Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Livemint

My year end musings: India at 77.
1. Go for growth. Let’s get enterprise and animal spirits firing.
2. ROTI is Return on time invested. Go relentlessly for productivity.
3. Shun protectionism. It may benefit in the short term. Long term it makes us uncompetitive.
4. We need a…

— Uday Kotak (@udaykotak)

As 2024 comes to a close, Uday Kotak shares ten key action points aimed at addressing India's growth and sustainable development in 2025. His insights cover a broad spectrum of issues from economic policies to environmental matters.

  • Focus on economic growth and fostering enterprise.
  • Emphasize productivity through effective time investment.
  • Discourage protectionist policies to maintain competitiveness.

Kotak's reflections serve as a strategic guide for navigating India's challenges in the coming year.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens on December 31: GMP, issue details, 10 key things to know before subscribing to the issue | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Opens on December 31: GMP, Issue Details

Publication Date: December 30, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Indo Farm Equipment IPO is set to open for subscription on December 31, 2023. The company, known for manufacturing tractors and cranes, aims to use the IPO proceeds for various growth initiatives.

  • IPO Dates: Opens on December 31, Closes on January 2.
  • Price Band: ₹204 to ₹215 per share.
  • Lot Size: 69 equity shares.
  • Objectives: Expanding production facilities, settling loans, and boosting investment in its subsidiary.
  • Expected Listing Date: January 7, 2024.
  • GMP: Currently at +90, suggesting a strong listing potential.
  • Allocation: 50% for QIB, 15% for NII, 35% for retail investors.
"Grey market premium indicates investors' willingness to pay above the issue price."

Investors are advised to consult with certified experts before making decisions regarding the IPO.

item.title: Only global factors can stop Sensex from hitting record high in 2025: Aamar Deo Singh of Angel One - The Economic Times
item.description:
Sensex Expected to Reach New Heights by 2025 Amid Global Challenges, Says Aamar Deo Singh

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Angel One

In a recent discussion, Aamar Deo Singh, Sr. Vice President of Research at Angel One, expressed optimism that Indian equities will soar to new heights in 2025, despite potential global factors such as political decisions and geopolitical tensions that could hinder progress.

  • Indian equities, despite recent setbacks, are expected to rebound and reach record highs by 2025.
  • Factors such as GDP growth slowdowns, geopolitical tensions, and the US Federal Reserve's policies could pose challenges.
  • India is projected to be one of the best-performing emerging markets due to strong government focus on economic stability.
  • Sensex and Nifty achieved unprecedented levels in 2024, demonstrating resilience against global challenges.
  • Proper portfolio management is crucial, especially with a moderate risk appetite.
“Despite global and local challenges, India is unshakable and on its way to becoming a global superpower.”

While Aamar Deo Singh acknowledges volatility in the equity markets, he believes that long-term investment in India's growing economy presents significant opportunities, particularly in sectors like defense, pharma, and financial services.

item.title: Air Canada aircraft catches fire after scary landing hours after fatal South Korea plane tragedy - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Air Canada Aircraft Catches Fire After Scary Landing

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: HT News Desk

An Air Canada flight experienced a harrowing incident at Halifax airport, skidding down the runway and catching fire due to a broken landing gear. This event occurred just hours after a deadly crash in South Korea.

  • An Air Canada flight made an emergency landing at Halifax airport.
  • The aircraft skidded and caught fire after suffering landing gear failure.
  • No casualties were reported in the Halifax incident.
  • The incident followed a tragic plane crash in South Korea, where a Jeju Air Boeing 737 exploded on landing, resulting in 179 presumed deaths.
  • Footage purportedly showed the aircraft's wings scraping the runway, leading to the fiery mishap.
“The Jeju Air plane was carrying 181 passengers; only two are confirmed survivors.”

This accident raises serious concerns about air safety, especially coming on the heels of another devastating plane mishap.

item.title: Market Outlook: Bull run in new year 2025’s first week? Experts see buying opportunities in THESE stocks - ET Now
item.description:
Market Outlook: Bull run in new year 2025’s first week?

Date: Updated Dec 29, 2024

Source: ET Now News

Domestic benchmark indices ended slightly higher, with hopes for a continued bull run in the new year. Stock market experts indicate mixed signals with opportunities in specific sectors.

  • Sensex closed at 78,699.07, and Nifty at 23,813.40.
  • The market saw indecisive activity in the last week, gaining only 1% for Nifty.
  • Experts highlight buying opportunities, especially in pharma, healthcare, and select FMCG stocks.
  • Important resistance levels for Nifty identified around 24,100–24,400.
  • Traders are advised to align strategies with market conditions focusing on fundamentally strong stocks.
“The markets continue to face resistance on the upside, reinforcing our negative outlook on the index. However, individual stocks are presenting opportunities on both sides.” – Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking.

As 2025 begins, investors will keep an eye on auto sales data, FII flows, and currency movements for clues on market direction.

item.title: Q3 business updates among 6 factors to sway stock market mood this week - The Economic Times
item.description:
Q3 Business Updates Among 6 Factors to Sway Stock Market Mood This Week

Date & Source: December 2023, Economic Times

The stock market is currently influenced by multiple factors as the Q3 earnings season approaches, with significant anticipation for auto sales data and quarterly updates from various sectors.

  • Auto Sales Data: Expected volume growth in December may highlight the auto sector, with sales figures due on January 1.
  • Quarterly Business Updates: Major sectors, including banking and FMCG, are set to announce quarterly updates in early January.
  • FII Flow: Foreign institutional investors have sold Rs 16,675 crore worth of Indian stocks in December.
  • Currency Movement: The rupee experienced significant depreciation against the US dollar, hitting a record low.
  • Macro Data: Upcoming major economic indicators will guide market outlook.
  • Technicals: Nifty is struggling to maintain its long-term moving average amid selling pressure.
"Persistent concerns over FII outflows and the depreciating rupee may impact the stock market in the short term." - Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services

Looking ahead, the stock market will be closely watching these factors as they could significantly influence investor sentiment and market direction.

item.title: Year Ender 2024: Big ticket investments boosts Tamil Nadu's USD 1 trillion dream - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Tamil Nadu's 2024 Progress Towards a $1 Trillion Economy

Publication Date: 2024

Source: [Insert Source Here]

Tamil Nadu made significant strides in 2024 to achieve its ambitious goal of a USD 1 trillion economy by 2030, driven by major investments and strategic policies initiated by the DMK government.

  • The state hosted its first Global Investors Meet (GIM) in January 2024, securing ₹6.64 lakh crore in investment commitments that could create 26 lakh jobs.
  • Significant investments include ₹16,000 crore from VinFast for a manufacturing facility, generating 20,000 jobs, and ₹9,000 crore from Tata Motors for electric vehicle production.
  • Chief Minister MK Stalin engaged with international investors, signing multiple MoUs in the US and Spain totaling ₹7,618 crore in commitments, leading to the creation of 12,000 jobs.
  • The government focused on boosting the electric vehicle sector by exploring charging infrastructure along major roads.
  • Mini-TIDEL Parks will be established to extend IT sector benefits to smaller towns, each accommodating around 500 IT professionals.
  • Political analyst Sumanth Raman highlighted the need for greater transparency regarding investment commitments with a public dashboard.
“It is the easiest thing to do (to set up a dashboard). But the government has not done it.” - Sumanth Raman

2024 was a key year for Tamil Nadu as it positioned itself for future economic growth amid ongoing efforts to strengthen investor relations and local job creation.

item.title: 1:5 Bonus share: 19852% returns! Record date on Jan 3 - Do you own? - ET Now
item.description:
Ceenik Exports Announces 1:5 Bonus Share with Massive Returns

Updated Dec 29, 2024 | Source: ET NOW DIGITAL

The announcement of a 1:5 bonus share for Ceenik Exports has caught the attention of investors, as the stock has significantly outperformed over recent years.

  • A multibagger stock will soon trade ex-date for 1:5 bonus issue.
  • The company commands a market cap of Rs 453.19 crore as of last close.
  • The stock delivered a robust return of 91% in the last six months.
  • Ceenik Exports has surged nearly 19852.80% over the last five years.
  • The record date for the bonus shares is set for January 3, 2025.
"Ceenik Exports’ shares have delivered a robust 91.66 per cent return in last six months and jumped 1104.09 per cent on a YTD basis."

The upcoming issuance of bonus shares is expected to further enhance shareholder value, as demonstrated by its performance and market interest.

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Mutual fund investment: Why smart investors would opt for SIPs in 2025? | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Mutual fund investment: Why smart investors would opt for SIPs in 2025?

Date: 2025
Source: Live Mint

As we enter 2025, the growing preference for Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) in the Indian mutual fund industry continues to gain momentum. Despite market volatility, SIPs are recognized for their ease of use and steady returns, making them a popular choice for long-term wealth accumulation.

  • SIPs allow disciplined investments of small sums every month.
  • They are highly effective for long-term investments due to compounding and rupee cost averaging.
  • SIPs help smooth out portfolio returns even during market fluctuations.
  • Experts suggest that SIPs encourage saving and investing habits, beneficial for long-term goals like retirement.
  • Consideration of step-up SIPs as a strategy for systematic increment in investments.
“SIPs are notable because their investments are profitable despite the high market fluctuations.” - Siddharth Maurya, Founder & Managing Director of Vibhavangal Anukulakara Private Limited

Looking ahead, SIPs are set to remain relevant for individuals aiming to invest for the long term.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors - News18
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors

Date: December 28, 2024
Source: News18

The Unimech Aerospace IPO is set to list on December 31, showing a 91.08% premium over its issue price of Rs 785, indicating significant investor interest.

  • The IPO received a remarkable 184.34 times subscription.
  • Unimech Aerospace shares are currently trading at Rs 1,500 in the grey market.
  • The listing will take place on both BSE and NSE.
  • The price band of the IPO was between Rs 745 and 785.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

This IPO is significant for its robust subscription figures and the expectation of solid gains for investors on its upcoming listing.

item.title: Why inflation will matter more in 2025: Explained - The Hindu
item.description:
Why Inflation Will Matter More in 2025: Explained

Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: Unknown

The article discusses the recent economic trends in India, highlighting a year of mixed economic performance, concerns over inflation, and the need for policy adjustments by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) amid rising tensions between government entities.

Key Points:

  • The year began with surprising growth, followed by a slowdown and inflationary pressures.
  • There are calls for the RBI to reduce interest rates to stimulate growth.
  • Recent GDP numbers have indicated a decline in growth rates, prompting concerns for the future.
  • The government has introduced measures in the 2024-25 Budget aimed at job creation and public spending to manage inflation.
  • Future economic strategies will revolve around balancing growth and inflation challenges.
“Growth moderated in the April-June quarter as high interest rates temper urban demand.” - Louis Kuijs, Asia-Pacific Chief Economist at S&P Global Ratings

In conclusion, the economic landscape heading into 2025 will be influenced significantly by the interplay of inflation management and growth stimulation policies.

item.title: DoT Seeks Finance Ministry Approval For Second BSNL VRS To Cut Workforce By 35%: Report - News18
item.description:
DoT Seeks Finance Ministry Approval For Second BSNL VRS To Cut Workforce By 35%

Last Updated: December 28, 2024, 17:30 IST

Source: Economic Times

The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) is preparing to seek approval from the finance ministry for a second voluntary retirement scheme (VRS) at Bharat Sanchar Nigam Limited (BSNL) as part of an effort to reduce its workforce by 35% and improve the company’s financial situation.

  • BSNL has requested Rs 15,000 crore from the finance ministry for VRS costs.
  • Proposed job cuts are between 18,000 to 19,000 employees.
  • BSNL plans to decrease salary expenditures from Rs 7,500 crore to Rs 5,000 crore annually.
  • The VRS programme was approved by BSNL’s board to reduce expenses before launching 4G services.
  • BSNL’s revenue for FY24 was Rs 21,302 crore, showing slight growth.
  • The government previously approved Rs 69,000 crore revival plan including an early retirement programme in 2019.
“The VRS plan is still under internal discussion, and no final decision has been made.”

This initiative aims to bolster BSNL's financial standing amidst ongoing challenges in the telecom sector.

item.title: Change in UPI Rule: RBI allows UPI access for prepaid payment instruments via third-party apps - The Times of India
item.description:
RBI Permits UPI Access for Prepaid Payment Instruments via Third-Party Applications

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced a significant change to its guidelines, enabling prepaid payment instruments (PPIs) to be linked to the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) through third-party applications. This decision aims to enhance the convenience of digital transactions for users.

  • The RBI's new rule allows PPIs to access UPI for seamless transactions.
  • This change is expected to boost digital payment adoption across various sectors.
  • Users will be able to link their prepaid wallets to UPI apps, facilitating easier payments.
  • The move aligns with the government's vision of promoting a cashless economy.
“This decision by the RBI marks a crucial step towards enhancing digital transactions in India,” said an industry expert.

In conclusion, this regulatory update from the RBI is poised to transform the landscape of digital payments in India, making it more accessible for users of prepaid payment instruments.

item.title: Big relief for debt-ridden Vodafone Idea from DoT – Details - ET Now
item.description:
Big Relief for Debt-Ridden Vodafone Idea from DoT – Details

Updated Dec 28, 2024 from ET Now

Vodafone Idea has received a critical relief from the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), which has waived the requirement for Bank Guarantees (BGs) for past spectrum auctions. This decision aims to bolster the telecom industry in India.

  • The waiver applies to spectrum auctions held in 2012, 2014, 2015, 2016, and 2021.
  • Prior to this reform, BGs totaling Rs 24,800 crore were required for each spectrum installment.
  • This initiative is expected to promote investment in 4G and 5G networks across India.
“The government's BG relief to the telecom industry will boost 4G and 5G investments in India.”

This significant move by the government is a reaffirmation of its support towards the telecom sector and aims to stimulate growth and modernization in India's telecommunications infrastructure.

item.title: As tech firms look to translate the promise of AI in 2025, 3 clear templates emerge - The Indian Express
item.description:
Three Key Templates for Monetizing AI in 2025

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The year 2024 brought the promise of generational AI, and as we move into 2025, the focus will shift to testing use cases and monetizing AI effectively.

  • 2025 will focus on practical applications and testing of AI tools.
  • Three compelling templates for AI use cases are anticipated.
  • The crucial question will be how to monetize AI tools.
"One hitch in all of this could be data – a key component of that scaling equation."

In summary, 2025 could shape the future of AI by identifying effective monetization strategies and use cases, influencing how the technology evolves.

item.title: Vodafone Group clears Rs 11,650 cr dues, releases pledged shares in Vodafone Idea - The Economic Times
item.description:
Vodafone Group Settles ₹11,650 Crore Dues, Releases Shares in Vodafone Idea

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: Economic Times

Vodafone Group has cleared outstanding dues of ₹11,650 crore, releasing its pledged shares in Vodafone Idea.

  • The group settled dues secured against its shares in Vodafone Idea.
  • Funds were raised through a debt arrangement involving HSBC Corporate Trustee Company (UK).
  • Vodafone Group had previously pledged its stake in Indus Towers to fund its rights issue in 2019.
  • HSBC released the shares upon repayment of the outstanding dues.
  • The Vodafone Group's stake in Vodafone Idea stands at 22.56% post-clearance.
“On 27 December 2024, HSBC Corporate Trustee Company (UK) Limited acting as the security trustee for the lenders has released the pledges pursuant to repayment of the outstanding dues owed to the lenders by the Vodafone Promoter Shareholders.”

This settlement allows Vodafone Group to regain its shareholding, enabling potential future investments in the growing Indian telecom market.

item.title: Multibagger Stock 2024: Rs 1 lakh turns into Rs 16 lakh with staggering 1060% return in just 1 year - ET Now
item.description:
Multibagger Stock 2024: Rs 1 lakh turns into Rs 16 lakh with staggering 1060% return in just 1 year

Updated Dec 28, 2024 by ET NOW

This article discusses the remarkable returns provided by Eraaya Lifespaces Limited, a smallcap multibagger stock, which has delivered an impressive 1060% return over the year 2024.

  • Eraaya Lifespaces Limited experienced a stock split in the ratio of 10:1.
  • The stock climbed from Rs 11.63 on January 1, 2024, to over Rs 1194 per share by December 2024.
  • If an investor had put in Rs 1 lakh, it would have grown to Rs 16 lakh by the end of 2024.
If you had invested Rs 1 lakh on shares of Eraaya Lifespaces Ltd on January 03, 2024 you would have received approximately 8500 shares at the price of Rs 12. It would have turned into Rs 16 lakh at the end of the year offering a return of 1060 per cent.

The stock has significantly appreciated due to its underlying business performance and strategic stock split, making shares more affordable and enhancing market liquidity.

item.title: Stock Picks for 2025: HDFC Bank to Senco Gold— Religare Broking suggests THESE six stocks to ‘accumulate’ for long-term | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock Picks for 2025: HDFC Bank to Senco Gold— Religare Broking suggests THESE six stocks to ‘accumulate’ for long-term

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed positive performance in 2024 with significant gains, but faced challenges in the second half. Analysts from Religare Broking advise accumulating fundamentally strong stocks for 2025 as several trends could impact markets.

  • 2024 saw sustained growth in major indices, with Nifty 50 and Sensex reaching new highs.
  • Challenges included weak corporate earnings and elevated inflation.
  • Key trends for 2025 involve shifts in US trade policies and geopolitical conflicts.
  • Analysts recommend focusing on stocks with solid balance sheets during market dips.
  • HDFC Bank identified as a key stock due to improvements in its credit-to-deposit ratio.
“Investors are advised to focus on accumulating fundamentally strong stocks during market dips.”

In conclusion, investors are presented with both opportunities and challenges as they navigate the markets in 2025.

item.title: Rs 20 Lakh Daily To Wipe-Out: Startup Founder Blames Amazon For Running Him Out Of Business - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Rs 20 Lakh Daily To Wipe-Out: Startup Founder Blames Amazon For Running Him Out Of Business

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Bloomberg Quint

An Indian entrepreneur's story of how his thriving business was allegedly destroyed by e-commerce giant Amazon has gone viral on social media, shedding light on the challenges faced by small businesses competing against the dominance of larger corporations.

  • The founder, Saumil Tripathi, of Grapevine, shared the story of a startup that made Rs 20 lakh daily before its downfall.
  • The startup offered affordable home storage solutions, sourcing products that were significantly cheaper than those on Amazon.
  • After declining a nine-figure acquisition offer from Amazon, the startup faced fierce competition when Amazon launched a competing private-label brand.
  • The entrepreneur's efforts to cut prices were ineffective against Amazon's ability to undercut further, leading to financial losses.
  • Despite challenges, the founder retains financial security but has lost his vision of creating generational wealth.
"I went from selling 20L of products per day to watching my generational-wealth dream crumble." — Saumil Tripathi

The narrative illustrates the overwhelming challenges small businesses face in the e-commerce landscape dominated by giants like Amazon, raising questions about fair competition and market practices.

item.title: Rs 3760 cr! Anil Ambani's 'zero debt' Reliance Group firm bags big financing from THIS Maharatna PSU - ET Now
item.description:
Anil Ambani's Reliance Power Secures ₹3760 Crore Financing from Maharatna PSU

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: ET Now

Reliance Power, led by Anil Ambani, has secured a significant financing of ₹3760 crore from the Power Finance Corporation (PFC) after recently achieving zero debt status.

  • The financing will be made available in one or more tranches.
  • The funds will be used for general corporate purposes and future investments in renewable energy projects.
  • Reliance Power's net worth has increased significantly, reporting ₹14,393 crore for the quarter ending September 2024.
“Rosa Power has become a zero-debt company by prepaying ₹485 crore loan to Varde Partners.”

This financing indicates Reliance Power's strategic move towards expanding its renewable energy capabilities while maintaining its commitment to a debt-free operation.

item.title: Jio Financial Services Share Price: A better stock for long term investment? Market expert Gaurang Shah answers - ET Now
item.description:
Is Jio Financial Services a Smart Long-Term Investment? Insights from Market Expert Gaurang Shah

Updated Dec 28, 2024 by ET NOW

Market expert Gaurang Shah provides an optimistic perspective on the potential of Jio Financial Services for long-term investors, emphasizing the importance of patience and strategic investment timing.

  • Gaurang Shah from Geojit Financial Services shares a positive long-term outlook for Jio Financial Services.
  • He stresses a timeframe of 1.5 to 2 years for significant developments due to regulatory processes.
  • Investors are advised to hold shares and consider increasing their investments at specific price levels.
  • New investors should start accumulating shares for a long-term vision.
"We do have positive coverage on Jio Financial Services from a long term point of view... our sense is that you need to have at least one and a half, 2 year plus of, kind of time horizon." - Gaurang Shah

The article highlights Shah's advice for both current and potential investors in Jio Financial Services, focusing on the necessary patience required to see significant impacts from the company's ongoing developments.

item.title: Telcos face twin challenges on tariffs, upcoming satellite services front - Business Standard
item.description:
Telecom Operators Confront Challenges from Tariff Hikes and Satellite Services

Publication Date: January 1, 2024

Source: Business Standard

Private telecom operators in India are grappling with significant challenges as they strive to recover investments amid subscriber loss from tariff hikes and emerging competition from satellite internet providers.

  • Private operators invested Rs 70,000 crore in telecom infrastructure in 2023.
  • Subscribers dropped sharply following tariff increases, with Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea losing a combined 26 million customers.
  • State-owned BSNL gained approximately 68,000 customers due to a lack of price hikes.
  • Push for 5G infrastructure continues despite market challenges, with significant investment anticipated in 2024.
  • Concerns arise over the imminent threat posed by satellite broadband providers like Starlink.
  • Political debates ensue over the allocation of spectrum to satellite providers without auctions.
  • Major telecom players are voicing opposition to the administrative allocation of spectrum to sidestep auctions.
“Telecom companies should not ignore low-paying customers and it is very much required to include them in the data-led digital economy.” - Prashant Singhal, EY India Markets and Telecom leader

The article highlights ongoing struggles within the telecom industry, with operators needing to balance investment recovery with customer retention strategies amidst fierce competition.
